8.1.23  1:30 am   Does what or how have to be in the result of a question, are there any other ways to form a figure of questioning?

     there are other ways

     Also, whenwhy?

     you have 'what' (among an infinite amount of permutations), you have 'which' (among a smaller, finite number of choices), you have 'yes/no', you have 'when' (expecting a time), you have 'why', which expects some explanation for something, you have 'where' which expects a place, you have 'how' which expects a method for something, you have 'how much', which expects a quantity, and you have 'how many' which usually expects a whole number. those are all i can think of now





PREVIOUS QUESTIONS

7.31.23  11:31 pm   I wanna write cool songs like yours but I have trouble finding a cool melody that fits with a cool chord progression. Got any tips?

      try starting with a melody. actually, the way i do it, the words+melody+chords usually hit all together, but i'm suggesting melody first for you because you've already been doing chords first. try to get words involved immediately also. whether the words are actually in the melody, or in between the melodies, or maybe just put a large sticker label on the song, with a word on it, and that may inspire some melodies to come out

7.31.23  9:50 pm   Can one person have multiple meanings of life?

     yes

     If so, what are the meanings of your life?

     i can't count them all, but one of them is learning to handle infinite possibilites

7.31.23  5:14 pm   Ugh, I just read the word "foodfluencer." I love a good portmanteau, but that is.... not a great one. Can you tell me a cool portmanteau to help cleanse my palette of the one I didn't like?

     'ghost' (gameshow host)

7.31.23  4:40 pm   Sometimes I find myself imagining reality rather than observing it(and I'm liking what I'm imagining); I tell myself it is ok because I know it is imagination. But then at a later time, I end up making a mistake and then realize that I had started taking that imagination for reality. So then I resolve to stop myself everytime I'm imagining, and that feels painful, and makes me stressed all the time. Does this happen to you too?

     sure

     What the hell even is happening and what is the solution? Should I stop myself from imagining everytime? If not, how do I never forget that what I'm imagining is not reality?

     you're always imagining somewhat. that's how we function. the actual raw reality, even just from what your sensory sensors are perceiving, is a firehose of data, which is unmanageable. the only way we are able to live our lives is to interpret that data as a recognizable thing. "it's a cat", etc.... so there almost is no such thing as truly observing what actual reality is. you're supposed to interpret it, which requires some imagination

7.30.23  8:53 pm   Is the number we're looking for in "9 8 7" 1?

     certainly a downward counting sequence starting with 9 seems to be headed toward 1..... also 0 of course

     The number that makes the whole thing blue would be, in RGB, a 0 for red and green, and a full value for blue. This could be interpreted as FF or 255, or 1 as in 100% of the blue channel on. Also, in statistics and computer science, 0 usually means false and 1 is true,

which would also make 1 the number that makes the whole thing true.

     the pivot point is more valuable to me, in a song. (the "whatever"). It's like when you sell a basket. the value of the basket is not based on the item you'll put in it today, tomorrow, or any other specific day. The value of the basket is that it's the hinge point between all possible things that COULD potentially go in the basket.

     It also makes sense of the "2 and 1, what have you done?" as it would mean that we finished counting to that number,

     this line carries a wide range of possible interpretations. because it's a question. it's on you, to answer. but mostly this section is about mathematical playfulness, along to that particular musical environment

     and the "1, 1, 2; 1, 1, 3; 1, 1, 1; 1, 1, meef" because at the end we find what we look for. I'm thinking of it as if it was guessing, "Is it 1, 1, 2? (No) Is it 1, 1, 3?..."

     that sounds about right. to me that actually would make it seem like meef is zero

      the hardest part is making the macaroni and making the cheese, which is unfortunately the part i don't know

7.30.23  3:24 pm   Is it even possible to write a bad song? I was thinking about it and I'm not sure if it is possible.

      if you try to write a good one, you'll usually get a bad one. so i think you're on the right track by wondering how bad you can get it

7.30.23  3:03 pm   is there a particular project of yours that taught you a lot while making it or is that just a standard thing for every project

      the one that really comes to mind is the parking lot video with all the cars ("Perfect"). this really solidified the phenomenon that if you do something 50 times, even if you are clueless the first 12 times, you start to find your way by about the 14th, and then you get super efficient by about the 25th. I watched this same exact phenomenon happen over and over and over again as i worked the assembly line in the modeling of 50 car models. from aligning the assembly line in the first place, to setting the initial shape and size, to wheels, to chassi, to roof to windows to plates to every little thing, done in the exact same order through all 50 models, and i watched the exact same cycle of cluelessness at first, finding the method somewhere between 10 and 20, and getting rock solid on it by the 30th. So reliable, makes me want to apply it to everything. And of course the other element of that car project, was the fact that i actually had to produce not 50 but 4000. And at such a high quantity, it requires me to invent/program a technique for doing it. If i only had to make 4 cars, i'd probably just make them all individually, and i won't really figure out what i'm doing. but if i have to make 4000, then i realize i can make 50 models to give enough variation, then i automatically learn a hell of a lot when tasked with propagating 50 to 4000, and also in making the 50. I vaguelly knew about all these phenomena before, but after doing that project it really made me realize the wide range of benefits that comes with unapologetically doing 4000 of something

7.30.23  9:44 am   how to play barre chords pls its so hard

      maybe if you become aware of which strings the bar finger is actually taking care of, then you'll know which ones it doesn't need to hit. for example, in E form, (chords like F, F#, etc) the bar finger only has to press the lowest, and 2 highest strings
